title: David Khurtsidze
text:
David Khvichayevich Khurtsidze (; born 4 July 1993) is a Russian <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a> who plays in Armenia for <a href="FC%20Alashkert">FC Alashkert</a>.
Club career.
In June 2013 Khurtsidze moved on a yearlong loan to <a href="FC%20Zenit%20Penza">Zenit Penza</a>. He made his debut in the <a href="Russian%20Second%20Division">Russian Second Division</a> for <a href="FC%20Zenit%20Penza">FC Zenit Penza</a> on 16 July 2013 in a game against <a href="FC%20Metallurg-Oskol%20Stary%20Oskol">FC Metallurg-Oskol Stary Oskol</a>.
In February 2016, Khurtsidze signed a contract with <a href="FC%20Amkar%20Perm">FC Amkar Perm</a> that began in the summer of 2016 (as he already played for two clubs in the 2015-16 season and was not eligible to be registered with Amkar in the winter).
In May 2017 Khurtsidze left Amkar Perm, signing for <a href="FC%20Torpedo%20Kutaisi">Torpedo Kutaisi</a> in June of the same year.
On 26 June 2019, Khurtsidze was one of 13 players to sign for <a href="FC%20Ararat%20Yerevan">Ararat Yerevan</a>. At the end of the <a href="2020%E2%80%9321%20FC%20Ararat%20Yerevan%20season">2020–21 season</a>, Ararat Yerevan announced that Khurtsidze had left the club after his contract had expired.
